### Favorite Books | ![We Are Not Free](https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1565710970l/49934666.jpg){width="120"} | ![This Place Is Still Beautiful](https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1634238514l/58984692.jpg){width="120"} | ![The Silence That Binds Us](https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1641068252l/59028585.jpg){width="120"} | ![Daughters of Shandong](https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1740179056i/223329042.jpg){width="120"} | ![The Kite Runner](https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1541428344i/17165596.jpg){width="120"} | |---|---|---|---|---| | ![Permanent Record](https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1564666396l/46223297.jpg){width="120"} | ![Ace](https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1580804471l/52128695.jpg){width="120"} | ![Minor Feelings](https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1580788273l/52845775.jpg){width="120"} | ![Quiet Power](https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1328562861i/8520610.jpg){width="120"} | ![Before The Coffee Gets Cold](https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1704153539l/44421460.jpg){width="120"} | | ![XOXO](https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1602086642i/54618808.jpg){width="120"} | ![Shine](https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1580350020i/50855956.jpg){width="120"} | ![Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children](https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1623449170l/9460487.jpg){width="120"} | ![These Violent Delights](https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1580958058i/50892212.jpg){width="120"} | ![The Lightning Thief](https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/books/1400602609i/28187.jpg){width="120"} | ### Favorite Comics I’ve read a ton of _X-Men_ over the years. Beyond the powers and fight scenes, I really love how the series reflects real-world struggles faced by marginalized communities, especially through its long-standing analogy to the Civil Rights Movement, with Magneto and Professor X often read as parallels to Malcolm X and Martin Luther King Jr. That underlying commentary is what’s kept me coming back to the series. Unrelated to all of that, here are a few panels I just find funny or memorable. ::: {style="overflow-x: auto; white-space: nowrap; padding: 10px; border-radius: 8px"} ```{r echo = FALSE} library(htmltools) # Grab all the comic images from the "comics" folder imgs <- list.files("comics", pattern = "\\.(png|jpg|jpeg)$", full.names = TRUE) # Get GLightbox so clicking an image pops it up glightbox_includes <- tags$head( tags$link(rel="stylesheet", href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/glightbox/dist/css/glightbox.min.css"), tags$script(src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/glightbox/dist/js/glightbox.min.js") ) # Make the HTML for the images in a horizontal scroll # each image is wrapped in a clickable tag for the popup # give them a little margin so they’re not squished together img_html <- paste0( sprintf( ' ', imgs, imgs ), collapse = "" ) # Wrap them all in a scrollable container so you can slide through horizontally container <- HTML(sprintf( '
%s
', img_html )) # initalize GLightbox once the page is ready # loop: true would allow arrows, but it's not working in Rmd init_script <- HTML('') # Put it all together so it actually shows up # browsable makes the HTML render in the output properly browsable(tagList( glightbox_includes, # include GLightbox CSS/JS container, # the scrollable gallery of images init_script # make the popup actually work )) ``` :::
